abstract: Management disagrees with union supporters who contend a walkout at Vale Inco can be traced to the fact that the mines are now owned by a Brazilian company.
snippet: Management disagrees with union supporters who contend a walkout at Vale Inco can be traced to the fact that the mines are now owned by a Brazilian company.
lead_paragraph: SUDBURY, Ontario  Last July, the 3,300 unionized workers who normally work deep below this city in the vast nickel mines owned by Vale Inco did something unusual: they went on strike even though they had already been laid off temporarily.

headline.main: Some in Canada Say Strike Shows Risk of Foreign Control
headline.print_headline: Some in Canada Say Strike Shows Risk of Foreign Control
